articles.title: Russian Strike on Kyiv Kills Three Including Child
articles.summary: A Russian attack on Ukraine's capital Kyiv killed three people including a child and sparked a fire at a government building. The assault marks another escalation in attacks on civilian infrastructure as the conflict continues into its fourth year.

articles.title: Japanese Prime Minister Ishiba Plans Resignation to Prevent Party Division
articles.summary: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba has decided to resign to avoid splitting the ruling Liberal Democratic Party. His coalition lost its Upper House majority in July's election as rivals within the party seek new leadership amid growing political tensions.

articles.title: Iran Offers Nuclear Monitoring Deal for Sanctions Relief
articles.summary: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi says Iran will accept nuclear monitoring in exchange for lifted sanctions. He urges European powers to change course and engage constructively in forging a new nuclear agreement as diplomatic tensions continue over Iran's atomic program.

articles.title: OPEC Plus Agrees to October Oil Production Increase
articles.summary: OPEC Plus will increase oil output in October as Saudi Arabia pushes to regain market share despite anticipated weakening global demand. The decision surprised markets amid concerns about a potential oil glut during northern hemisphere winter months ahead.

articles.title: Mozambique Secures Six Billion Dollar Hydroelectric Project Backing
articles.summary: Mozambique has won World Bank support for a six billion dollar hydroelectric plant, southern Africa's largest such project in fifty years. The massive infrastructure investment aims to boost regional electricity supply and support economic development across multiple African nations.

articles.title: Japanese Firm NGK Insulators Pioneers Carbon Capture Technology
articles.summary: NGK Insulators, a global leader in ceramic components, is developing revolutionary carbon dioxide capture technology to combat climate change. The Japanese company's patented system can remove CO2 directly from air as industries worldwide accelerate away from fossil fuel dependence.

articles.title: Anthropic Claude Restrictions Impact Chinese Backed AI Tools Globally
articles.summary: American AI firm Anthropic's decision to restrict Claude service to Chinese-owned entities worldwide has created uncertainty for overseas AI tools. Chinese AI companies are seizing the opportunity to attract disgruntled users affected by these new access limitations.

articles.title: New Weight Loss Pill Could Reach UK Next Year
articles.summary: Eli Lilly's new weight loss pill orforglipron could reach the UK by next year, offering an easier alternative to injections for needle-averse patients. The Mounjaro manufacturer's oral medication represents a significant advancement in obesity treatment options.

articles.title: US Treasury Secretary Calls for Collapsing Russian Economy
articles.summary: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent signaled Sunday that the United States is open to partnering with European countries to impose more sanctions on Russia. He emphasized the need for transatlantic cooperation to collapse the Russian economy amid the ongoing Ukraine conflict.

articles.title: China Sends Military Aircraft with Earthquake Aid to Afghanistan
articles.summary: Two Chinese Y-20 military transport aircraft arrived in Kabul delivering humanitarian aid to earthquake-hit Afghanistan. The mission, carrying tents and blankets, highlights growing strategic trust between China and Taliban-controlled Afghanistan following recent devastating seismic activity.
